newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkish grain board plans $250-mln syndicated loan.
newsitem.headline: Turkish grain board plans $250-mln syndicated loan.

text.p: Turkey's state grain board (TMO) plans to tap international markets for a $250 million syndicated loan for its grain purchases in 1997/98, farm officials said.
They said the maturity of the loan might be two years and will be used to buy a total of $3.5 million tonnes of grain for 1997/98, up from 1.5 million tonnes a year ago.
One official told Reuters the Treasury, which he said had approved the borrowing plan, would administer the arrangements for the syndication.
The TMO will begin purchases from farmers after the government announces grain support prices in early June.
